result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trunail Dantray Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 2 Dismissed, But Read In to case 15CM946.

Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown  NOT in court, in custody, with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Final Pretrial Conference.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter, and requested a Plea & Sentencing date. Court VACATED jury Trial date of 6/29/2015. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Trunail Dantray Brown not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with STEPHANIE B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Trunail Dantray Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
